intro: Otites nemoralis, commonly known as the wood sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Violaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and meadows. Otites nemoralis is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in temperate climates. Its flowers attract pollinators like bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
